alert.note: Alert for North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 12:36PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Elbert and north central Lincoln Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1234 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado 7 miles north of Limon, nearly stationary. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Elbert and north central Lincoln Counties. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
